bug.author: AlexisBRENON
bug.summary: Profiler API and Service are not available
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/tensorboard/tensorboard_profiling_keras#other_ways_for_profiling>https://www.tensorflow.org/tensorboard/tensorboard_profiling_keras#other_ways_for_profiling</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of the issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
The guide presents the profiler API and service as other ways of profiling. Both of these use modules inside the tensorflow.python package. However, this package does not seem to exist as exhibited by the error message: <denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- AttributeError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-14-c7b3d51d1060> in <module>() ----> 1 with tf.python.eager.profiler.Profiler('logdir_path'): 2 # do your training here 3 pass 4 5
AttributeError: module 'tensorflow' has no attribute 'python' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
I would be pleased to submit a pull request, but do not know if there is any TF2.0 compatible way to use profile API or service.

comments.comment: Was able to reproduce the issue. Please find the gist <denchmark-link:https://colab.sandbox.google.com/gist/gowthamkpr/d2ddb1cfc3be57ae387be5fcabab8e92/copy-of-external-tensorboard_profiling_keras.ipynb>here</denchmark-link> . Thanks!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/AlexisBRENON>@AlexisBRENON</denchmark-link> Can you try: from tensorflow.python.eager import profiler with profiler.Profiler('logdir_path'): pass
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/qiuminxu>@qiuminxu</denchmark-link> This seems to work. However, is it not fragile to import something from ?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/AlexisBRENON>@AlexisBRENON</denchmark-link> , yes, ideally we want to have a tf.profiler public API, but that is not exposed yet. The public API is under discussion, and hopefully we will have a version early next year.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/qiuminxu>@qiuminxu</denchmark-link> Is there a place where I can follow the discussion and API progress?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/AlexisBRENON>@AlexisBRENON</denchmark-link> , sorry for the wait. The public API is finally available in TF 2.2. <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.2/api_docs/python/tf/profiler/experimental>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.2/api_docs/python/tf/profiler/experimental</denchmark-link>
They are tf.profiler.experimental.xxx for now, for the first release, and will be moved to tf.profiler in the next release. from tensorflow.python.eager import profiler continues to work in this release, but will be deprecated and move to the new API. The good news is the new API also comes with more tools and features: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/profiler>https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/profiler</denchmark-link>
Looking forward to hear your experience trying out :)
Thanks for the feedback. I'll try that ASAP. I suppose that IÂ can close this issue.
